lessons.interactiveContent:
Let's explore complex property types. We'll start with arrays.

Pass an array as the value for the property friends.

Make sure to pick friends followed by = and then {, ["Eve", "Snake"], }.

lessons.title: da - Copy - Copy - Copy - Copy
lessons.interactiveContent:
If the array's values are of type string, we can render them directly. Notice that there is no whitespace between the rendered elements.

However, there are much better ways to render arrays in React. We'll learn about them soon.

Make sure to pick { followed by props and then ., friends, }.

lessons.title: ddsf
lessons.interactiveContent:
Objects can also be passed as properties.

Define the property called description and pass it as the value for the property called description.

Make sure to pick description, followed by { title: "forager", hobby: "napper" }, and finally description.

lessons.title: ddsf - Copy
lessons.interactiveContent:
We can pass the object directly instead of saving it in a variable first.

Here, we see two opening and two closing curly braces. It might look odd, but both JSX and objects use curly braces.

Make sure to pick { title: "forager", hobby: "napper" }.

lessons.title: ddsf - Copy - Copy
lessons.interactiveContent:
We can't directly render objects, but we can log them.

Log the passed description object.

Make sure to pick props, followed by ., and finally description.

lessons.title: ddsf - Copy - Copy - Copy
lessons.interactiveContent:
We can use dot notation to access the values of the description object, which is part of the props object.

Print the value of the field title of the description object by coding props.description.title.

Make sure to pick { followed by props and then ., description, ., title, }.

lessons.title: Lesson #7
lessons.interactiveContent:
Pass an array as a property in React.

Make sure to pick [ followed by "Ron", and then "Hermione", ].

lessons.title: Lesson #8
lessons.interactiveContent:
What is the proper way to pass an array as a prop to a React component?

friends={Ron, Hermione}friends="Ron, Hermione"friends=[Ron, Hermione]friends={["Ron", "Hermione"]}

friends={["Ron", "Hermione"]}.

lessons.title: Lesson #9
lessons.interactiveContent:
Pass an object directly as a property.

Make sure to pick { followed by title: "The Hobbit", and then author: "J.R.R. Tolkien", }.

lessons.title: Lesson #10
lessons.interactiveContent:
Given the following code snippet, what type of data is being passed as a prop?

StringObjectArrayNumber

Make sure to pick Object.

lessons.title: Lesson #11
lessons.interactiveContent:
Use dot notation to access an object's properties.

Make sure to pick props followed by . and then movie, ., title.

lessons.title: Lesson #12
lessons.interactiveContent:
How would you access the language property of the book object passed to this component?

props.book.languageprops["book"]["language"]book.languagelanguage

Make sure to pick props.book.language.
